intro: Hieracium serum, commonly known as mouse milk, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers with a distinctive, milky sap that is toxic to livestock. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and upright. Hieracium serum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
